Mirror / Music : Ghazal is the future |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2012-06-13 |accessdate=2013-10-05}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://skore.in/post/66190554996/we-talked-to-the-rising-star-of-ghazal-aditya |title=The Score Magazine / Ek Garam Chai with |publisher=The Score Magazine |date=2013-11-01 |accessdate=2013-11-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203020411/http://skore.in/post/66190554996/we-talked-to-the-rising-star-of-ghazal-aditya |archivedate=2013-12-03 }}</ref> He is best known for his award winning [[ghazals]], and international singles in [[Classical Music|classical]], [[Pop music|pop]], and [[World music|world]] music genres.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/adithya-srinivasan/id599803506 |title=iTunes USA Artist Page / Adithya Srinivasan| publisher=Apple Inc. |date=2013-01-11 |accessdate=2014-07-23}}</ref>{{Advert inline|date=November 2014}} His notable performances include sharing stage space with [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]] and opening for [[Ghulam Ali (Ghazal singer)|Ghulam Ali]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vimeo.com/76220059 |title=Adithya Srinivasan Opening Act Ghulam Ali - Live in Concert / Music : Adithya Srinivasan Opening Act Ghulam Ali - Live in Concert |publisher=Imagine Events|date=2012-04-08 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref>
== Music career == Adithya's tribute to 6 ghazals originally rendered by [[Mehdi Hassan]], [[Jagjit Singh]], [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]], [[Ghulam Ali (singer)|Ghulam Ali]] and [[Pankaj Udhas]] won him the Singer of the Year Silver Award from Swar Systems, [[Switzerland]].
Adithya's first international single Gham-e-Duniya written by the [[Mughal tribe|Mughal]] poet [[Mirza Ghalib]] and featuring a [[Miss Diva]] finalist, earned a 5 star rating on [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] [[iTunes]], and went viral on [[YouTube]].
In 2014, Adithya featured [[Grammy]] nominated pianist Jonathan Wesley and flautist Parth Chandiramani for Tu Hi Dilruba, landing a consideration in the 57th [[Grammy]] Awards ballot, and a Silver Award in the [[Southeast Asian]] VIMA Music Awards.
Adithya collaborated with [[Massachusetts]] based composer Sonaljit and [[Hollywood]] screen & stage actress Yanna Fabian for Devanke in 2015, landing a consideration in the 58th [[Grammy]] Awards ballot, a nomination in the 3rd Radio City Freedom Awards, and a Judge's Special Award in the [[Southeast Asian]] VIMA Music Awards.
In 2017, Adithya released Aarzu, an all acoustic ghazal written by [[Daagh Dehlvi]]. The single featured musicians from across [[India]], and was mastered by a [[Grammy]] winning engineer at the [[Abbey Road Studios]], [[United Kingdom]].
Adithya also featured on [[Grammy]] winning composer [[Laura Sullivan (composer)|Laura Sullivan]]'s 900 Voices.
== Corporate career ==
Adithya is a [[Singapore Management University]] graduate, and has worked in [[management consulting]] and [[investment banking]]. He is also a co-founder of MzQ! Entertainment, a [[digital commerce]] boutique.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/130721/entertainment-tvmusic/article/words-ghalib |title=Deccan Chronicle / Music : From the words of Ghalib ... |publisher=Deccan Chronicle |date=2013-06-21 |accessdate=2013-08-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203002513/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/130721/entertainment-tvmusic/article/words-ghalib |archivedate=2013-12-03 }}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=pastissues2&BaseHref=BGMIR/2013/04/02&PageLabel=2&EntityId=Pc00206&ViewMode=HTML |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Singers Bond |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2013-04-02 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=pastissues2&BaseHref=BGMIR/2013/07/09&PageLabel=2&EntityId=Ar00204&ViewMode=HTML |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Going Viral |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2013-07-09 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=MIRRORNEW&BaseHref=BGMIR%2F2014%2F04%2F14&PageLabel=20&EntityId=Ar02000&ViewMode=GIF |title=Bangalore Mirror / Music : Made Here, Mastered Elsewhere |publisher=Bangalore Mirror |date=2013-07-09 |accessdate=2013-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.newindianexpress.com/c/3004185 |title=Indian Express / Music : B'lore singer to send track for Grammys | publisher=Indian Express |date=2014-06-17 |accessdate=2014-06-20}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mzqentertainment.com/ |title=MzQ! Entertainment / Indian digital commerce boutique | publisher=GoDaddy/Weebly |date=2014-08-04 |accessdate=2014-08-04}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.donateasy.com/|title=Donateasy / philanthropic dot-com enterprise | publisher=GoDaddy/Weebly |date=2014-07-19 |accessdate=2014-10-21}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.deccanchronicle.com/articledetailpage.aspx?id=124716 |title=Donateasy / Goodwill Hunting |publisher=Deccan Chronicle |date=2014-10-27 |accessdate=2014-10-27 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangaloremirror.com/bangalore/others/Family-records-single-to-allay-sons-fears/articleshow/48240805.cms|title=Family records single to allay son’s fears | publisher=Times Bangalore Mirror |date=2015-07-28 |accessdate=2015-08-13}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/society/adithya-srinivasan-journey-as-a-singer/article7173450.ece|title=The techie sings a new tune | publisher=The Hindu |date=2015-07-28 |accessdate=2015-05-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://globalvima.com/2016/05/02/vima-music-awards-final-nominees/ |title=VIMA MUSIC AWARDS Final Nominees |publisher=VIMA MUSIC AWARDS |date=2016-05-02 |accessdate=2016-05-02 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://sg.linkedin.com/in/adithyasrinivasan |title=Adithya Srinivasan LinkedIn |publisher=LinkedIn |date=2016-05-30 |accessdate=2016-05-30 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>

[[Andrey Guryev, Jr.]] (brother-in-law) | website = }} '''Alexei Motlokhov''' (born 1981/82) is a London-based Russian hedge fund manager. ==Early life== Alexei Motlokhov is the son of [[Vladimir Motlokhov]], who works for the Russian fertilizer giant, [[PhosAgro]] (controlled by [[Andrey Guryev]]), and was vice-governor of the Murmansk region from 2000 to 2008, where PhosAgro mines its phosphate. Motlokhov received a PhD in economics in 2006. ==Career== Motlokhov runs the hedge fund Kola Capital with [[Mike Hollings]] and [[Ken Ginsburg]], and they operate the [[Cayman Islands]]-domiciled Kola Global Opportunities Fund, amongst others.{{cite web|author=Rob Langston |url=https://hfm.global/hfmweek/news/exclusive-industry-veterans-launch-kola-capital-with-100m/ |title=Industry veterans launch Kola Capital with $100m | HFM Week | An HFM network |publisher=Hfm.global |date=1 August 2013 |accessdate=3 July 2017}} ==Personal life== Motlokhov is married to Yulia Guryeva-Motlokhov, the daughter of Russian billionaire [[Andrey Guryev]].{{cite web|author=David Churchill |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/row-over-hedge-fund-bosss-theme-park-plan-for-highgate-a3578156.html |title=Row over hedge fund boss's 'theme park' plan for Highgate | London Evening Standard |publisher=Standard.co.uk |date= |accessdate=3 July 2017}} They have twin sons and live next door to Guryev, who owns [[Witanhurst]] in Highgate, London's second largest house after [[Buckingham Palace]].{{cite news|last1=Caesar|first1=Ed|title=House of Secrets: Who owns London’s most expensive mansion?|url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/06/01/house-of-secrets?intcid=mod-yml|accessdate=24 May 2015|work=New Yorker|issue=June 2015}} Several local residents wrote to [[Camden London Borough Council|Camden Council]] about a 57-metre long adventure playground that they were planning to build in their back garden, complaining that "The plans are on a commercial scale and it looks like this will be more like a theme park than a playground." ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Motlokhov, Alexei}} [[Category:1980s births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hedge fund managers]] [[Category:Russian emigrants to the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]]

[[File:Highwic House Above Newmarket NZ.jpg|thumb|Highwic House above [[Newmarket, New Zealand|Newmarket]]]] '''Alfred Buckland''' (17 December 1825 – 12 June 1903) was a New Zealand landowner, auctioneer, farmer, pastoralist and businessman. His house, [[Highwic]], is registered by the [[New Zealand Historic Places Trust]] as a Category I structure, with registration number 18.<ref name="NZHPT 18">{{NZHPT|18|Highwic|3 November 2012}}</ref>
==Family== Buckland was born in [[Newton Abbot]], [[Devon]]shire, England on 17 December 1825.<ref name="DNZB Buckland">{{DNZB|Stacpoole|John|authorlink=John Stacpoole|1b44|Alfred Buckland|3 November 2012}}</ref> His mother was Elizabeth (née Mortimore) and his father was the broker John Buckland. [[William Thorne Buckland]] was an elder brother who had arrived in [[Auckland]] in 1841 via [[Adelaide]].<ref name="DNZB Buckland" /><ref>{{cite news |title=Untitled |url=http://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&cl=search&d=NZH18760118.2.13 |accessdate=19 June 2015 |work=[[The New Zealand Herald]] |volume=XIII |issue=4424 |date=18 January 1876 |page=2}}</ref> [[Frank Buckland (politician)|Frank Buckland]] and [[John Channing Buckland]] were his nephews.<ref name="DNZB1940 Buckland">{{cite book | ref = harv | editor-last = Scholefield | editor-first = Guy | editor-link = Guy Scholefield | title = A Dictionary of New Zealand Biography : A–L | volume = I | year = 1940 | publisher = [[Department of Internal Affairs (New Zealand)|Department of Internal Affairs]] | location = Wellington | url = http://www.nzhistory.net.nz/files/documents/dnzb-1940/scholefield-dnzb-v1.pdf | accessdate = 6 October 2013 |page=114}}</ref>
== Arrival in New Zealand == According to his [[obituary]], Buckland was a farmer before leaving England in August 1850. Alfred and his wife Eliza arrived in New Zealand on the ''Sir Edward Paget'' in December 1850. In 1867, Buckland married Matilda Frodshan, shortly after the death of Eliza.<ref name="SweetVilla">{{cite book|author1=Jan Harris|author2=|title=Sweet Villa of Highwic - The Story of Highwic and the Buckland Family|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rmR7MQAACAAJ&dq=isbn:090857732X&hl=en&sa=X&ei=OrwqUcDvN-HvmAXSmIGQDA&redir_esc=y|accessdate=25 February 2013|year=1996|publisher=|isbn=0-908577-32-X|page=}}</ref>
== Life in New Zealand == Buckland supplied horses to the British troops during the [[New Zealand Wars]] and along with James Banks, Thomas Morrin and then-[[Mayor of Auckland]] [[James Clark (businessman)|J. McCocsh Clark]] sold off a piece of land near [[Ellerslie Racecourse]] to the Auckland Agricultural and Pastoral Association. He was later President of the association in 1883 and 1886.<ref name="SweetVilla" /> Alfred died aged 77 on 12 June 1903. He was regarded as "highly esteemed" and in [[Wellington]] was reported as "the well-known auctioneer".<ref name="SweetVilla" />
==References== {{Reflist}}

[[File:Coto (cropped).jpg|thumb|Alfredo Coto]] '''Alfredo Coto''' (born October 9, 1941) is a prominent Argentine businessman.
==Life== Alfredo Coto was born in [[Buenos Aires]] in 1941. His father, Joaquín Coto, was an [[Immigration in Argentina|immigrant]] from [[Galicia (Spain)]], and the owner of a small [[butcher]] shop in the [[Retiro, Buenos Aires|Retiro]] section of the city. Working alongside his father from age nine, and joining him in neighborhood deliveries, Coto became a wholesaler in 1963, buying [[rump roast]] and other cuts from a [[Kosher]] butcher who could not use them.<ref name=majul>Majul, Luis. ''Los nuevos ricos de la Argentina''. Buenos Aires: Editorial Sudamericana, 1997.</ref> He opened his own, [[Boedo]] neighborhood retail butcher in 1969, and managed the shop with his wife, Gloria.<ref name=nacion>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=751855 ''La Nación'': Alfredo Coto, un imperio tras las góndolas] {{es icon}}</ref>
Building on the customer base that the couple had cultivated through wholesale delivery, Coto owned 20 shops by 1976, and began supplying [[steakhouse]]s. He purchased a [[cattle ranch]] in 1978, and in 1981, a [[slaughterhouse]], thus becoming his own supplier. Coto's success made him a target, however, and in 1981, he was held for 11 days in a ransom [[kidnapping]].<ref name=majul/>
Operating 34 retail outlets by 1987, each averaging around 40 tons of [[beef]] and [[offal]] sales a month, he opened his first [[supermarket]] in [[Mar de Ajó]] (a seaside tourist destination).<ref>[http://www.coto.com.ar/ Coto] {{es icon}}</ref> [[Coto Supermarkets]] expanded rapidly afterwards, and in 1992, he opened his first [[hypermarket]]. The company opened five [[shopping mall]]s from the late 1990s onwards (each anchored by a Coto hypermarket), as well as a wholesale distribution and production center in [[Monte Grande]].<ref name=clarin>[http://edant.clarin.com/diario/1997/05/23/o-02801d.htm ''Clarín'': Coto lanza dos hipermercados y un centro de distribución] {{es icon}}</ref>
The chain, a [[sole proprietorship]], remained a [[private company]]; a ''[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín]]'' article at the time, however, outlined that by 1996, it netted over a billion [[US dollars]] in sales, and that its [[net income]] exceeded US$31 million.<ref name=clarin/>
Coto and his chain were reportedly the targets of [[extortion]] during 1996 and 1997, when bombs were placed in five outlets by the self-styled People's Revolutionary Organization.<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=61475 ''La Nación'': Más amenazas de atentados contra Coto] {{es icon}}</ref> More fortunate than other targets, the Coto chain suffered no damages, and the group was later apprehended by police.<ref>[http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/elpais/1-4415-2002-04-25.html ''Página/12'': Condenas de hasta 18 años a la ORP que atacó a Bergés] {{es icon}}</ref>
The acquisition of the Norte chain by [[France|French]] retailer [[Carrefour]] in 2000 left Coto as the largest domestic supermarket retailer in Argentina, and Coto remained third overall (behind Carrefour and [[Chile]]an retailer [[Cencosud]]).<ref>[http://www.carrefour.com/cdc/finance/publications-and-presentations/financial-releases/-norte-.html Carrefour: Financial releases] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720134353/http://www.carrefour.com/cdc/finance/publications-and-presentations/financial-releases/-norte-.html |date=2011-07-20 }}</ref>
The largest domestic grocer in a country where [[inflation]] is problematic, as well as perennially contentious in politics, Coto was personally criticized in a November 2005 press conference by President [[Néstor Kirchner]], who, discussing retailers' role in rising inflation, referred to the businessman using the company's slogan, ''yo te conozco'' ("I know you").<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=759065 ''La Nación'': Kirchner volvió a apuntar contra los súper] {{es icon}}</ref> Coto maintained cordial relations with the government, however,<ref>[http://www.diarioperfil.com.ar/edimp/0172/articulo.php?art=560&ed=0172 ''Diario Perfil'': Kirchner primero pega, después negocia] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120124114931/http://www.diarioperfil.com.ar/edimp/0172/articulo.php?art=560&ed=0172 |date=January 24, 2012 }} {{es icon}}</ref> and himself later downplayed the inflation issue.<ref>[http://criticadigital.com/index.php?secc=nota&nid=9104&pagina=11 ''Crítica de la Argentina'': Coto minimizó alcances de la inflación] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301032140/http://criticadigital.com/index.php?secc=nota&nid=9104&pagina=11 |date=2012-03-01 }} {{es icon}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Use British English|date=May 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2012}} '''(Alby) Anand Kurian''' is a marketing communications theorist and writer; he has been featured among thirty marketers from around the world. He has conceived and developed the twin marketing management concepts of Reality Plus - Neo People and other allied concepts. His recent concept 'Conflict as a Marketing Tool (CAMT)' was published by Knowledge@wharton and by the Wharton Center for Leadership and Change Management.
His first book, The Peddler of Soaps, a political novel against religious fundamentalism, was on the best-seller list.
For his next book, a work of non-fiction, professionals from all over the world such as Narayana Murthy, Javed Akhtar and IIM professors are interpreting his management concepts, in their own areas of specialisation.
== Education ==
He was educated at [[Bombay Scottish School]], [[St. Xavier's College, Mumbai|St. Xavier’s College]], [[Elphinstone College]] and [[Government Law College, Mumbai]].(These institutions were criticized for being elitist.). He was first in his division at the [[University of Cambridge]] Indian School Certificate examination, graduated with honours, and was awarded scholarships throughout an unorthodox academic career.<ref name ="author profile">{{cite web |url=http://www.bookandborrow.com/AuthorDetails.asp?autID=1171|title= Author Profile |accessdate=16 May 2010}}</ref><ref name="IIM Conf3" />
He qualified as a lawyer; he topped [[Moot Court]]s in [[Mumbai University]], in [[Maharashtra State]] and in [[India]].<ref name ="profile1">{{cite web |url=http://www.aicar.net/Mandatory_Disclosure.pdf |title= Business School profile |accessdate=20 May 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130807033736/http://www.aicar.net/Mandatory_Disclosure.pdf|archive-date=7 August 2013}}</ref><ref name ="profile">{{cite web |url=http://www.aicar.net/faculty.htm |title= Business School guest faculty profile |accessdate=22 October 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081202143756/http://www.aicar.net/faculty.htm| archivedate= 2 December 2008}}</ref><ref name="Openlib">{{cite web |url=http://openlibrary.org/a/OL1524503A |title= Anand Kurian|publisher=Open Library}}</ref><ref name="Profile4">{{cite web |url=http://www.flame.edu.in/pdfs/prospectus/FSC_Prospectus2010.pdf |title= Business School Profile |accessdate=18 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101122115923/http://flame.edu.in/pdfs/prospectus/FSC_Prospectus2010.pdf| archivedate= 22 November 2010}}</ref>
His [[thesis]] for his [[PhD]] in [[Management]] was recommended by two former deans of [[Indian Institutes of Management|IIM]] [[Ahmedabad]], and featured original contributions from the co-authors of [[Philip Kotler]]’s classic on marketing.
== Advertising career ==
He trained in advertising in New York and founded Emphasis. The company has conceived and executed advertising work for multinational majors such as [[Procter & Gamble]], [[Nestlé]], [[Colgate-Palmolive]], [[PepsiCo]] and [[Unilever]], and for products such as [[Lay's]], [[Ariel (laundry)|Ariel]], [[Lifebuoy]] and [[Coca-Cola]], making him an early fortune.<ref name="profile" /><ref name="Openlib" /><ref name="Portfolio">{{cite web| url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zgMPfUxE5lQ |title= Emphasis Portfolio'' |accessdate=9 September 2012 |year=2012|publisher=Youtube }}</ref>
== The struggle against religious fundamentalism ==
The rise of [[religious fundamentalism]] occurred at this time; Anand Kurian wrote ''The Peddler of Soaps'', a political novel set against this period. The book predicted the [[2002 Gujarat violence|Gujarat riots]]; it was published just before it erupted.<ref name="Hindu">{{cite web| url=http://www.hinduonnet.com/thehindu/mp/2002/12/12/stories/2002121200380300.htm |title= Interview in ''The Hindu'' |accessdate=22 October 2008 |year=2002|work=The Hindu }}</ref><ref name="afaqs">{{cite web |url=http://cities.expressindia.com/fullstory.php?newsid=37160 |title=CHATTERATI |accessdate=22 October 2008 |date=4 December 2002 |publisher=Indian Express Newspapers }}</ref><ref name="Fable">{{cite web|url=http://www.afaqs.com/perl/news/?sid=5300 |title=Part fable, part critique |publisher=Afaqs |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725053037/http://www.afaqs.com/perl/news/?sid=5300 |archivedate=25 July 2011 }}</ref>
The book found support among intellectuals, celebrities, newspaper editors and national award winning actors; among them were [[Vir Sanghvi]], [[Shabana Azmi]], [[Shobhaa De]] and [[Tabu (actress)|Tabu]].<ref name="Openlib2">{{cite web |url=http://openlibrary.org/b/OL3713285M/peddler-of-soaps |title= Peddler of Soaps|publisher=Open Library}}</ref><ref name="Stars">{{cite web |url=http://cities.expressindia.com/fullstory.php?newsid=38113 |title= Star endorsements |work=The Indian Express }}</ref>
[[File:Book Launch Peddler of Soaps New Delhi.jpg|thumb|right|Launch of The Peddler of Soaps, New Delhi; with Javed Akhtar and Arnab Goswami]]
Sanghvi described The Peddler of Soaps as ‘Deceptively simple, a contemporary, modern-day fable’; Azmi called it ‘The right book for these wrong times’.<ref name="Openlib2" /><ref name="Launch1">{{cite web |url=https://picasaweb.google.com/117639393005686324054/LaunchOfAnandKurianSBookThePeddlerOfSoapsInMumbaiNewDelhi#5637272465388851042 |title= New Delhi launch pic of Peddler of Soaps|publisher=WLI Foundation}}</ref><ref name="Launch2">{{cite web |url=https://picasaweb.google.com/117639393005686324054/LaunchOfAnandKurianSBookThePeddlerOfSoapsInMumbaiNewDelhi#5637272429893102114 |title= Mumbai launch pic of Peddler of Soaps|publisher=WLI Foundation}}</ref><ref name="Cover1">{{cite web |url=https://picasaweb.google.com/117639393005686324054/BookCoverOfThePeddlerOfSoaps#5643296762218244674 |title= Book Cover (Front)|publisher=WLI Foundation}}</ref><ref name="Cover2">{{cite web |url=https://picasaweb.google.com/117639393005686324054/BookCoverOfThePeddlerOfSoaps#5643296777176767714 |title= Book Cover (Back)|publisher=WLI Foundation}}</ref>
In its review, ''[[India Today]]'' said, "It explores the tantalisingly complex issue of why multicultural societies lapse into violence and communal rioting."<ref name="ReviewIT">{{cite web |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/every-ad-man-dreams-of-making-a-feature-film-anand-kurian/1/207293.html |title= India Today Book Review|work=India Today}}</ref> <ref name="Review">{{cite web |url=http://www.indiatoday.com/itoday/20030113/books2.html |title= India Today Review|work=India Today}}</ref> ''[[The Hindu]]'' described it as "Beguilingly simple..."<ref name="Review2">{{cite news |url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/lf/2002/12/24/stories/2002122400380200.htm |title= Review in The Hindu|work=The Hindu | location=Chennai, India |date=24 December 2002}}</ref> Critical reviewers and readers dubbed it as [[pseudo-secular]].<ref name="Critic">{{cite web| url=http://simplymanjari.blogspot.com/ |title= Criticism |accessdate=21 February 2010 |year=2002|publisher=Blogspot.com}}</ref>
His use of the small letter ‘i’ for the personal pronoun ‘I’ (in certain chapters of the book), has now been adopted in the editorial page of The Times of India.<ref name="I">{{cite web| url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Default/Scripting/ArticleWin.asp?From=Archive&Source=Page&Skin=TOINEW&BaseHref=TOIM/2011/08/10&PageLabel=22&EntityId=Ar02201&ViewMode=HTML |title= Small 'i' for 'I' Criticism |accessdate=10 August 2011 |year=2011|work=The Times of India }}</ref>
The book was on the India Today [[best-seller]] list<ref name="Bestseller">{{cite web |url=http://archives.digitaltoday.in/indiatoday/20030210/books2.html |title= India Today Best seller list|work=India Today}}</ref> and it topped the best-seller charts of ''[[The Times of India]]'', ''[[The Financial Express (India)|The Financial Express]]'' and ''[[The Indian Express]]''.<ref name="Review2" /><ref name="Bestseller2">{{cite web|url=http://www.the-week.com/23jan19/life9.htm |title=An Unlikely Best-seller |accessdate=9 June 2012 |year=2002 |publisher=The Week |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030117094101/http://www.the-week.com/23jan19/life9.htm |archivedate=17 January 2003 }}</ref> It was to be made into a film by [[Mansoor Khan]] but the project was still-born.<ref name="Openlib2" />
== Key management concepts ==
His recent concept ''Conflict as a Marketing Tool (CAMT)'' was published by Knowledge@wharton and by the Wharton Center for Leadership and Change Management. <ref name ="conflict">{{cite web |url=http://knowledge.wharton.upenn.edu/article/conflict-new-marketing-tool/|title= Conflict as Marketing Tool ||publisher=Knowledge@Wharton}}</ref> <ref name ="conflict2">{{cite web |url=https://leadershipcenter.wharton.upenn.edu/tag/alby-anand-kurian//|title= Conflict as Marketing Tool ||publisher=Wharton Center for Leadership and Change Management}}</ref>
Other key management concepts include:
a) ''‘Reality Plus’''<ref name="Reality Plus" /><ref name="Reality2">{{cite web|url=http://www.afaqs.com/perl/news/story.html?sid=18387 |title=Reality & Reality Plus |publisher=Afaqs |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725054426/http://www.afaqs.com/perl/news/story.html?sid=18387 |archivedate=25 July 2011 }}</ref>
b) ''‘Neo People’''<ref name="Neo">{{cite web |url=http://sites.google.com/a/anandkurian.com/concep/ne |title= Neo People|work=The Journal of the All India Management Association}}</ref>
c) ''‘Simulated Obsolescence’''<ref name="Simulated Obsolescence" /><ref name="Simulated">{{cite web |url=http://www.exchange4media.com/Viewpoint/viewpoint.asp?view_id=100 |title= Simulated Obsolescence|publisher=exchange4media}}</ref>
d)''‘The Afghanistan Syndrome’''.<ref name="The Afghanistan Syndrome" /><ref name="Afghan2">{{cite news |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/3783365.cms |title= The Afghanistan Syndrome (Source 1)|work=The Times of India | first1=Chidanand |last1=Rajghatta |date=14 March 2002}}</ref><ref name="Afghan3">{{cite news |url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=WT&p_theme=wt&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_text_search-0=afghanistan%20AND%20sheep&s_dispstring=afghanistan%20sheep%20AND%20date(2002)&p_field_date-0=YMD_date&p_params_date-0=date:B,E&p_text_date-0=2002&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&xcal_useweights=no |title= The Afghanistan Syndrome (Source 2)|work=The Washington Times}}</ref>
e) ''‘The Universal Integrators model’'',<ref name="UI">{{cite web|url=http://www.afaqs.com/perl/news/story.html?sid=25810 |title=Universal Integrators |publisher=Afaqs |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091221134843/http://www.afaqs.com/perl/news/story.html?sid=25810 |archivedate=21 December 2009 }}</ref><ref name="UI2">{{cite web |url=http://sites.google.com/a/anandkurian.com/concep/universal-integrators |title= Universal Integrators | work=The Journal of the All India Management Association}}</ref>
f) ''‘The Transference Response’'',<ref name="TR">{{cite web |url=http://sites.google.com/a/anandkurian.com/concep/the-transference-response |title= Transference Response|work=The Journal of the All India Management Association}}</ref>
g)''‘The Laggard's Lock’'',<ref name="lock">{{cite web |url=http://sites.google.com/a/anandkurian.com/concep/the-laggard-s-lock |title= The Laggard's Lock|work=The Journal of the All India Management Association}}</ref><ref name="lock2">{{cite web|url=http://www.khabarmedia.com/article/articledetails/id:5 |title=The Laggard's Lock |publisher=KhabarMedia |accessdate=20 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110713145222/http://www.khabarmedia.com/article/articledetails/id%3A5 |archivedate=13 July 2011 }}</ref> (co-written with Nitin Borwankar)
h) ''‘Co-omperation’'' <ref name="Co-omperation">{{cite web |url=http://sites.google.com/a/anandkurian.com/concep/co-omperation |title= Co-omperation|work=The Journal of the All India Management Association}}</ref>
i) ''‘Triple F Model’''<ref name ="triple f">{{cite web |url=https://sites.google.com/a/anandkurian.com/concep/the-triple-f-model|title= Applying the Triple F Model to Steve Jobs ||publisher=Journal of the All India Management Association}}</ref> <ref name ="triple f2">{{cite web |url=http://www.business-standard.com/india/news/the-apple-story/476485/|title= The Triple F Model & Steve Jobs ||publisher=The Business Standard}}</ref>
j) The Mirror Maxim'<ref name ="mirror">{{cite web |url=http://www.afaqs.com/news/story/36095_Guest-Article:-Alby-Anand-Kurian:-The-Mirror-Maxim|title= The Mirror Maxim ||publisher=afaqs}}</ref>
k) The Entrepreneurial Readiness Index (co-written with Ms Koon Lai Tan)<ref name ="Entreprenurship">{{cite web |url=https://mdis.edu.sg/images/110667%20MDIS%20Journal%206%20Jan%202016%20(Low%20Res)-min.pdf |title=The Entrepreneurial Readiness Index|publisher=MDIS Journal}}</ref>
He has lectured on these concepts at the [[Indian Institutes of Management]] (IIMs), at the [[Film and Television Institute of India]] (FTII), at the [[National Institute of Design]] (NID) <ref name="Reality Plus">{{cite web |url=http://www.business-standard.com/india/storypage.php?autono=339050 |title= Reality Plus|work=Business Standard}}</ref><ref name="Simulated Obsolescence">{{cite web |url=http://www.businessstandard.com/india/storypage.php?autono=333153 |title= Simulated Obsolescence|work=Business Standard}}</ref><ref name="The Afghanistan Syndrome">{{cite web |url=http://www.business-standard.com/india/storypage.php?autono=335122 |title= The Afghanistan Syndrome|work=Business Standard}}</ref> at IIM conferences,<ref name="IIM Conf3">{{cite web|url=http://www.iimkhorizons.com/speakers.htm |title=Speaker Profile, IIM Conference |accessdate=27 November 2011 |publisher=IIM |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111202091135/http://www.iimkhorizons.com/speakers.htm |archivedate=2 December 2011 }}</ref><ref name="IIM Conf" >{{cite web |url=http://www.iimkbackwaters.com/ |title=Talk at IIM Conference |accessdate=25 November 2011 |publisher=IIM 2011}}</ref><ref name="IIM Conf2" >{{cite web |url=http://blog.iimklive.com/?p=515 |title=The Triple Bottom-Line: People, Planet, Profit |accessdate=25 November 2011 |publisher=IIM Conference}}</ref> to members of the [[Indian Administrative Services]] (IAS), <ref name="IAS" >{{cite web |url=http://picasaweb.google.com/117639393005686324054/AnandKurianSTalkToGovernmentIASOfficers# |title=Talk at IAS officers Conference (pictures) |accessdate=2 April 2010 |publisher=Government of Maharashtra}}</ref> at CEO conclaves, to industry bodies, to faculty and students of universities all over the world<ref name="UK" >{{cite web |url=http://www.brunel.ac.uk/bbs/news-and-events/news/ne_172853/ |title=UK University talk |accessdate=7 July 2012 |publisher=Brunel University UK}}</ref> and at international conferences all over the world.<ref name="IIM pictures">{{cite web |url=http://picasaweb.google.com/iicofiiml/AnandKurian# |title=Industry Interaction with IIM pictures (Anand Kurian pictures) |accessdate=6 August 2009 |publisher=Indian Institute of Management |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121106121055/http://picasaweb.google.com/iicofiiml/AnandKurian |archive-date=6 November 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="ERA">{{cite web|url=http://www.era.org.in/convention/mumbai/2010/CEOConclave.asp |title=Lecture at CEO forum (pictures) |publisher=Executive Recruiters Association |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100120013424/http://www.era.org.in/convention/Mumbai/2010/CEOConclave.asp |archivedate=20 January 2010 }}</ref><ref name="CEO">{{cite web |url=http://picasaweb.google.com/jay1886/ERA160110?feat=email#5431339401488035970 |title= CEO"s Conclave|publisher=Executive Recruiters Association}}</ref>
== Articles, keynote addresses & lectures ==
His message against communalism is summarised in the dictum ''‘A world without borders... people without labels.’''<ref name="Openlib" />
"The Indian way", a keynote Convocation Address at the [[Mudra Institute of Communications, Ahmedabad]] (MICA) is an analysis of the strengths and weaknesses of the Indian way of life.<ref name="The Indian Way">{{cite web |url=http://www.business-standard.com/india/storypage.php?autono=241258 |title= The Indian Way|work=Business Standard}}</ref><ref name="The Indian Way2">{{cite web |url=http://www.afaqs.com/news/story.html?sid=15233 |title= The Indian Way|work=AFaqs}}</ref>
In "Racing on the fast track" Anand Kurian takes a critical look at the [[caste system]]. His use of his [[Adi Sankara]] [[Brahmin]] lineage "to fight fire with fire" has been criticized.<ref name="The Caste System">{{cite web|url=http://www.hvk.org/articles/0606/16.html |title=Racing on the fast track |work=Hindustan Times |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100620112818/http://hvk.org/articles/0606/16.html |archivedate=20 June 2010 }}</ref><ref name="Brittanica">{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/115071/Christian-caste |title= Caste among Syrian Christians |work=Encyclopædia Britannica |accessdate=19 March 2010}}</ref><ref name="Hindutva">{{cite web|url=http://www.hindutva.org/christianity.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20070815073058/http://www.hindutva.org/christianity.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=15 August 2007 |title=Nambudiri origin |publisher=hindutva.org |accessdate=19 March 2010 }}</ref>
He has founded [[Switch, India's first campus channel|India's first campus channel]]; the Chairman of [[Cadbury's]] described it as "an example of the power of an innovative idea." Along with two former Deans of the [[Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad]], he has designed a subject ''‘The New Culture of Business’'', for management students.<ref name="Reality Plus" /> He has introduced courses on ‘The Business of Cinema’ to management education in India.<ref name="MICA">{{cite web| url= http://www.indiaprwire.com/pressrelease/education/2010032546580.htm| title= Film & Entertainment| publisher= Mudra Institute of Communications, Ahmedabad (MICA)| accessdate= 31 March 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100328210819/http://www.indiaprwire.com/pressrelease/education/2010032546580.htm| archivedate= 28 March 2010| deadurl= yes| df= dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="Film Marketing">{{cite web |url=http://www.hindu.com/2010/09/14/stories/2010091460830300.htm |title= Film Marketing |publisher= The Hindu |accessdate=23 August 2012}}</ref>
He has addressed Chinese government officials, academicians, businessmen and professionals, in Hangzhou, China on “What’s Next for China”. <ref name ="What’s Next for China">{{cite web |url=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:What%27s_Next_for_China,_Talk_by_Anand_Kurian_2.jpg|title= What’s Next for China ||publisher=wikimedia}}</ref>
== Today ==
Currently based in Singapore, he is working on his next book, a work of non-fiction. Professionals from diverse fields, all over the world – such as [[N. R. Narayana Murthy|Narayana Murthy]], [[R. Balki]], [[Sagarika Ghose]], [[Ashis Nandy]], Abraham Koshy (of [[IIM, Ahmedabad]]), [[Javed Akhtar]] and [[R Gopalakrishnan]] – are interpreting his concepts, in their areas of specialisation, for the book.<ref name="Openlib2" />
He is part of an international brand consultancy; he has been cited for multi-media innovations, and has served on juries for professional awards.<ref name="juries">{{cite web|url=http://www.eventfaqs.com/index.php?rlink=topstory/top_stories_inner.php&csrid=2434 |title=Award jury |publisher=Eventfaqs }}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He has been profiled in ‘Marketing people’ (Barnes & Noble), a book about thirty marketers from around the world.<ref name="IIM Conf3"/>
But his feature film has been long delayed; critics have described him as unorthodox and unconventional.<ref name="Openlib2" /><ref name="MICA2">{{cite web|url=http://www.ahmedabadmirror.com/article/3/2010032620100326025115791323b0e14/Learning-filmi-funda.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130116115329/http://www.ahmedabadmirror.com/article/3/2010032620100326025115791323b0e14/Learning-filmi-funda.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=16 January 2013 |title=Filmi Fundas |work=The Times of India, Ahmedabad |accessdate=2 April 2010 }}</ref>
However, a former Dean of [[IIM, Ahmedabad]] Dr Parikh says, "He draws from [[cultural anthropology]] as well as from [[McKinsey & Company|McKinsey]]. He straddles both [[left brain|left]] and [[right brain]] territory to create a new, more dynamic picture."
Says another erstwhile Dean of IIM, Ahmedabad,Dr Shingi, "He is a [[polymath|Renaissance man]]; he helps us see, beyond narrow specializations, the complete picture."<ref name="Openlib" />

page.title: Arthur W. Page Center for Integrity in Public Communication

revision.text:
The '''Arthur W. Page Center for Integrity in Public Communication''' is a research center at the [[Donald P. Bellisario College of Communications]] at the [[Pennsylvania State University]]. The center is dedicated to the study and advancement of ethics and responsibility in [[corporate communication]] and other forms of public communication.<ref>http://pagecenter.comm.psu.edu/</ref>
==History== The center is named for [[Arthur W. Page]], widely regarded as the founder of modern corporate [[public relations]], whose views have been distilled into the Page Principles: (1) tell the truth; (2) prove it with action; (3) listen to stakeholders; (4) manage for tomorrow; (5) conduct public relations as if the whole enterprise depends on it; (6) realize that an enterprise's true character is expressed by its people; and (7) remain calm, patient and good-humored.<ref>http://bellisario.psu.edu/page-center/about/arthur-w-page/the-page-principles</ref>
Bringing the center to Penn State was the idea of alumnus Lawrence G. Foster, who retired as corporate vice-president of public relations at [[Johnson & Johnson]]. The launch was made possible by a $300,000 gift he and his wife Ellen made to the college. Foster worked on the project with Edward M. Block, retired vice-president of public relations at [[AT&T]], and John A. Koten, retired senior vice president of corporate communications at [[Ameritech]]. All three played leading roles in the formation of [http://www.awpagesociety.com The Arthur W. Page Society], which functions as a separate entity.
==The Arthur W. Page Center Awards== The Page Center annually honors individuals who, over the course of their careers, have demonstrated consistent and fervent commitment to the concept of “truth well told." Three icons of the profession are recognized each February at an awards dinner held in New York City. Hundreds of professionals attend as the honorees are given a Larry Foster Award for Integrity in Public Communication, named after the center's founder. Past honorees include Ann Barkelew, Dick Martin, Alan Murray,<ref>http://bellisario.psu.edu/page-center/events/archive-awards2017</ref> [[Bill George (academic)|Bill George]], [[Gwen Ifill]] and John Onoda.<ref>http://bellisario.psu.edu/page-center/events/archive-awards2018</ref>
==Research and projects==
The Page Center seeks to foster a modern understanding and application of the Page principles and Robert Wood Johnson’s business philosophy by supporting innovative research, educational or public service projects in a variety of academic disciplines and professional fields.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pagecenter.comm.psu.edu/index.php?option%3Dcom_content%26task%3Dview%26id%3D276 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720032301/http://pagecenter.comm.psu.edu/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=276 |archivedate=2011-07-20 |df= }}</ref>
The center supports three ongoing programs, as set out below.
===Page/Johnson legacy scholars=== As of April 2018, the center has awarded more than $900,000 to scholars and professionals throughout the world to support research that makes important contributions to knowledge, practice or public understanding of ethics and responsibility in public communication or other principles of Arthur W. Page. Topics of research have included digital media, corporate social responsibility, sustainability, advocacy and fake news. <ref>http://bellisario.psu.edu/page-center/grants/legacy-scholar-grants</ref>
===Oral history collection=== Printable transcripts, streaming video, and searchable indexed content provide history, analysis and individual comment on public relations and the media from the luminaries in the field. To date, the Center has conducted 31 interviews and has transcribed and indexed many acquired videos from the Arthur W. Page Society and other contributors.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pagecenter.comm.psu.edu/index.php?option%3Dcom_content%26task%3Dview%26id%3D276 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720032301/http://pagecenter.comm.psu.edu/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=276 |archivedate=2011-07-20 |df= }}</ref>
===Page archive=== The Page Center also is the archive for Page’s previously uncollected papers and memorabilia and related research materials in the area of ethics in public communication and corporate responsibility.

{{See also|Ance (disambiguation)}} '''Associazione Nazionale Costruttori Edili''' ('''ANCE''') is the '''Italian Association of private construction contractors''', active in public works, residential and industrial building. It represents 20 regional organisations, 101 provincial associations and 20,000 construction companies of any specialization and dimension.
ANCE and its local associations safeguard the construction industry ''vis a vis'' the Government and Parliament, through its lobbying activity. ANCE also engages in dialogue with political, social and cultural Institutions.
ANCE ensures relationships with Administrative Authorities in governing the territory, planning investments and designing interventions.
ANCE and its local Associations offers assistance and consultancy services in the following fields: *legislative *economic and industrial relations
ANCE is engaged in: *Tendering for public procurement and relationships with the employers; *Public and private Financing; *Technical innovation and quality certification; *The implementation of fiscal regulations; *Company qualification for Public works
At the International level ANCE adheres to: *FIEC – [[European Construction Industry Federation]] *EIC – [[European International Contractors]] *UNICE – [[Union of Industrial and Employers' Confederations of Europe]] through ''Confindustria - Confederazione Generale dell’Industria Italiana'' *UEPC – ''Union Europeenne des Promoteurs-Constructeurs''
==External links== *[http://www.ance.it/ Official site (Italian)]

'''Awi Federgruen''' (born 1953, [[Geneva]]) is a Dutch/American mathematician and [[operations research]]er and Charles E. Exley Professor of Management at the [[Columbia University]] Graduate School of Business and affiliate professor at the university's [[School of Engineering and Applied Science (Columbia University)|Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science]].
== Biography == Federgruen received his BA from the [[University of Amsterdam]] in 1972, where he also received his MS in 1975 and his PhD in Operations Research in 1978<ref name="CE 2013">http://www4.gsb.columbia.edu/cbs-directory/detail/494917/Awi+Federgruen {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002172927/http://www4.gsb.columbia.edu/cbs-directory/detail/494917/Awi+Federgruen |date=2013-10-02 }} [http://www0.gsb.columbia.edu/whoswho/bio.cfm?UNI=af7]</ref> with a thesis entitled "Markovian Control Problems, Functional Equations and Algorithms" under supervision of [[Gijsbert de Leve]] and [[Henk Tijms]].<ref name="MG">{{mathgenealogy|name=Awi Federgruen|id=68360}}.</ref>
Federgruen started his academic career as Research Fellow at the [[Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica]], Amsterdam early 1970s, and was faculty member of the [[University of Rochester]], Graduate School of Management. In 1979 he was appointed Professor at the [[Columbia University]]. In 1992 he was named the first Charles E. Exley Jr. Professor of Management,<ref>Columbia Daily Spectator, Volume CXVI, Number 127, 30 November 1992.</ref> and holds the Chair of the Decision, Risk and Operations (DRO) Division. From 1997 to 2002 he was Vice Dean of the University.<ref>[http://www4.gsb.columbia.edu/cbs-directory/detail/494917/Awi+Federgruen AWI FEDERGRUEN] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002172927/http://www4.gsb.columbia.edu/cbs-directory/detail/494917/Awi+Federgruen |date=2013-10-02 }} at gsb.columbia.edu, 2004.</ref> He serves as a principal consultant for the Israel Air Force, in the area of logistics and procurement policies.
Federgruen has supervised many PhD students;<ref name="MG"/> recent graduates include Yusheng Zheng (at Wharton Business School, University of Pennsylvania), Ziv Katalan (at Wharton Business School, University of Pennsylvania), Fernando Bernstein (Fuqua Business School, Duke university), [[Joern Meissner]] (Kuehne Logistics University in Hamburg, Germany), Gad Allon (Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University), Nan Yang (Olin Business School, Washington University), Margaret Pierson (Havard Business School), and Yossi AVIV (Olin Business School, Washington University), see <ref>[http://www4.gsb.columbia.edu/dro/phd/recentplacements PhD Placements at Columbia Business School] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091227035957/http://www4.gsb.columbia.edu/dro/phd/recentplacements |date=2009-12-27 }}</ref>
Federgruen was awarded the 2004 Distinguished Fellowship Award by the Manufacturing, Service and Operations Management society for Outstanding Research and Scholarship in Operations Management; and also the Distinguished Fellow, Manufacturing and Service Operations Management Society.<ref>[http://msom.society.informs.org/Minutes/04FDenverMinutes.html MSOM Business Meeting Minutes, INFORMS Denver Conference<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://msom.society.informs.org/FellowsSummary.html MSOM Distinguished Fellow Award<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
== Work == Federgruen is known for his work in the development and implementation of planning models for supply chain management and logistical systems. His work on scenario planning is widely cited, the field has gained prominence as computers now allow the processing of large masses of complex data.<ref>Theory and Practice of Leadership, , by Roger Gill , 2006, p. 197</ref><ref>Management Consulting: Delivering An Effective Project, by Philip A. Wickham 2004, p. 111</ref>
His work on supply chain models has wide applications in, for example, flu vaccine and the risks of relying too heavily on a single vaccine supplier.<ref>[http://www0.gsb.columbia.edu/ideasatwork/magazinefeature?top.showsendarticle=yes&main.view=articles.detail&main.id=59882]{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
He is also an expert on applied probability models and dynamic programming. In the wake of [[Hurricane Katrina]], Federgruen was quoted on the subject of applying predictive models to minimize risk in disaster situations.<ref>[http://www2.gsb.columbia.edu/hermes/fall2005/article_bestlaidplans.cfm Columbia Business School: Hermes Magazine<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070728212656/http://www2.gsb.columbia.edu/hermes/fall2005/article_bestlaidplans.cfm |date=2007-07-28 }}</ref>
== Publications == Books, a selection: * 1978. ''Markovian Control Problems, Functional Equations and Algorithms''. Doctorate thesis University of Amsterdam.
Articles, a selection: * {{cite journal|last1=Federgruen |first1=Awi |first2=Aliza |last2=Heching |url=http://teaching.ust.hk/~ieem610l/IEEM557_files/documents/fedegruen99.pdf |title=Combined pricing and inventory control under uncertainty |journal=Operations research |volume=47 |issue=3 |year=1999 |pages=454–475 |doi=10.1287/opre.47.3.454 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140514110225/http://teaching.ust.hk/~ieem610l/IEEM557_files/documents/fedegruen99.pdf |archivedate=2014-05-14 |df= }} * {{cite journal | last1 = Chen | first1 = Fangruo | first2 = Awi | last2 = Federgruen | first3 = Yu-Sheng | last3 = Zheng | title = Coordination mechanisms for a distribution system with one supplier and multiple retailers | journal = Management Science | volume = 47 | issue = 5 | year = 2001 | pages = 693–708 | doi=10.1287/mnsc.47.5.693.10484}} * {{cite journal | last1 = Bernstein | first1 = Fernando | first2 = Awi | last2 = Federgruen | title = Decentralized supply chains with competing retailers under demand uncertainty | citeseerx = 10.1.1.198.1317 | journal = Management Science | volume = 51 | issue = 1 | year = 2005 | pages = 18–29 | doi=10.1287/mnsc.1040.0218}}

{{Infobox officeholder | name = Cavit Çağlar | honorific-suffix = | image = | imagesize = 225px | caption = | birth_date = 1944 | birth_place = [[Komotini]], Greece | office = Minister of State | term_start = 1991 | term_end = 1993 | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | constituency3 = | nationality = [[Turkey|Turkish]] | party = [[True Path Party (Turkey)|True Path Party]] | website = }} '''Cavit Çağlar''' (born on 1944, [[Komotini]], [[Greece]]) is a [[Turkish people|Turkish]] [[businessman]] and politician. He was elected to the [[Grand National Assembly of Turkey]] (TBMM) for the [[True Path Party (Turkey)|True Path Party]] (DYP) in 1991, serving as a Minister of State responsible for state-owned banks ([[51st government of Turkey|51]]st and [[52nd government of Turkey]]). He resigned from the DYP in 1996, remaining in parliament as an independent until 1999. He had been a major financial contributor to the political comeback of President [[Suleyman Demirel]].<ref name=TDN1997/> In 2004 he was sentenced to three years ten months for bank fraud.
==Early life==
Çağlar was born in [[Komotini]], [[Greece]] to ethnic Turks, moving to Turkey when he was still at school. He left school at age 15 when his father died to look after his family. He entered the textile business, joining his uncle, a textile merchant in [[Bursa]]. With his uncle's support and state loans, he built up a large industrial and trade group, Nergis Holding, which in 1996 had turnover of around $1bn and exports of around $200m. Based around textiles, by 1996 it also included major real estate investments (including in tourist facilities around the [[Sea of Marmara]]), and publishing and broadcasting ventures, including news channel [[NTV (Turkey)|NTV]].<ref name=TDN1997>[[Turkish Daily News]], 8 January 1997, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkeys-first-24-hour-tv-news-channel-begins-broadcasts.aspx?pageID=438&n=turkeys-first-24-hour-tv-news-channel-begins-broadcasts-1997-01-08 Turkey's first 24-hour TV news channel begins broadcasts]</ref>
==Career==
In 1996 Nergis acquired [[Çukurova Holding]]'s majority stake in [[İnterbank]].<ref name=TBB>TBB, [http://en.tbb.org.tr/Dosyalar/userfiles/file/%C4%B0statistik-%C4%B0ngilizce%20site/Historical%20data/Historical%20Data%20about%20Closed%20Banks.xls Historical Data about Closed Banks - tbb.org.tr] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141205130050/http://en.tbb.org.tr/Dosyalar/userfiles/file/%C4%B0statistik-%C4%B0ngilizce%20site/Historical%20data/Historical%20Data%20about%20Closed%20Banks.xls |date=2014-12-05 }}</ref> In December 1997 [[Etibank]] was privatised to Medya-Ipek Holding, co-owned by Çağlar and [[Dinç Bilgin]], for $155m,<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 3 December 1997, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/this-time-cavit-caglar-buys-etibank.aspx?pageID=438&n=this-time-cavit-caglar-buys-etibank-1997-12-03 This time, Cavit Caglar buys Etibank]</ref> and in September 1998 Çağlar was celebrating a $1bn investment in textile production with Demirel opening the new factories.<ref>[http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/caglar-prepares-to-activate-an-investment-of-1-billion.aspx?pageID=438&n=caglar-prepares-to-activate-an-investment-of-1-billion-1998-09-29 Caglar prepares to activate an investment of $1 billion]</ref> In February 1998 police uncovered a plot to assassinate Çağlar by a group working for [[Alaattin Çakıcı]], related to the bank privatization.<ref>[http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/police-uncover-plan-to-assassinate-businessman.aspx?pageID=438&n=police-uncover-plan-to-assassinate-businessman-1998-02-16 Police uncover plan to assassinate businessman]</ref>
On 7 January 1999 [[İnterbank]], then majority-owned by Nergis Holding, was transferred to the [[TMSF]].<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 9 January 1999, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/interbank-taken-over-by-central-bank.aspx?pageID=438&n=interbank-taken-over-by-central-bank-1999-01-09 Interbank taken over by Central Bank]</ref> It was later merged with [[Etibank]], before being liquidated.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 17 January 1999, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/default.aspx?pageid=438&n=the-week-in-perspective-1999-01-17 The Week in Perspective]</ref><ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 19 June 2004, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/tmsf-reaches-agreement-with-former-owners-of-two-failed-banks.aspx?pageID=438&n=tmsf-reaches-agreement-with-former-owners-of-two-failed-banks-2004-06-19 TMSF reaches agreement with former owners of two failed banks]</ref> Later in January, NTV was sold to the [[Dogus Group]].<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 13 January 1999, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/dogus-group-buys-ntv.aspx?pageID=438&n=dogus-group-buys-ntv-1999-01-13 Dogus Group buys NTV]</ref> In June 1999 prosecutors alleged that in 1998 Interbank had transferred over $650m to Nergis Holding companies - far in excess of legal limits for intra-group transfers.<ref name=TDNentangles/> The total amount owed by Nergis to Interbank was said to be over $1.1bn.<ref name=TDNentangles>[[Turkish Daily News]], [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/interbank-fraud-case-entangles-former-politicians.aspx?pageID=438&n=interbank-fraud-case-entangles-former-politicians-1999-06-27 Interbank Fraud Case Entangles Former Politicians]</ref> In January 2001 Turkey issued a warrant for his arrest, accusing Çağlar of using a $7.4m business bank loan for personal use. He was arrested in New York in April, and agreed to return to Turkey to face trial after a New York court denied a $5m bail application.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 30 April 2001, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/dgm-imprisons-former-minister-pending-trial.aspx?pageID=438&n=dgm-imprisons-former-minister-pending-trial-2001-04-30 DGM imprisons former minister pending trial]</ref><ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 22 April 2001, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/caglar-agrees-to-waive-extradition.aspx?pageID=438&n=caglar-agrees-to-waive-extradition-2001-04-22 Caglar agrees to waive extradition]</ref><ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 20 April 2001, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/us-court-rejects-caglars-offer-to-post-5-mln-bail.aspx?pageID=438&n=us-court-rejects-caglars-offer-to-post-5-mln-bail-2001-04-20 US court rejects Caglar's offer to post $5 mln bail]</ref>
In 2004 Çağlar agreed to pay TMSF $1.6bn for debts relating to Interbank. When he failed to keep up payments, some of his other companies were seized, including his 50% stake in BİS Enerji, an electricity generating company in Bursa.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 19 October 2009, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/caglars-plant-appetizes-energy-giants.aspx?pageID=438&n=caglar8217s-plant-appetizes-energy-giants-2009-10-19 Çağlar's plant appetizes energy giants]</ref> Hotels, helicopters and media assets were also seized, and the Nergis Holding textile companies suffered financial difficulties, with 785 workers put on unpaid leave for over three months in 2008.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 28 March 2008, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/nergis-workers-face-further-unpaid-leave.aspx?pageID=438&n=nergis-workers-face-further-unpaid-leave-2008-03-28 Nergis workers face further unpaid leave]</ref> Yeşim Tekstil was foreclosed by [[Halkbank]] in 2008 after debts reached $45m.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 4 January 2008,[http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/yesim-tekstil-up-for-sale.aspx?pageID=438&n=yesim-tekstil-up-for-sale-2008-01-04 Yeşim Tekstil up for sale]</ref> In October 2008 Çağlar agreed to sell the remaining textile companies.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 8 October 2008, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/cavit-caglars-companies-up-for-sale.aspx?pageID=438&n=cavit-caglars-companies-up-for-sale-2008-10-08 Cavit Çağlar's companies up for sale]</ref>
In 2004 Çağlar was sentenced to three years ten months for bank fraud relating to the bankruptcy of Interbank.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/default.aspx?pageid=438&n=former-minister-sentenced-for-bank-fraud-2004-12-25 Former minister sentenced for bank fraud]</ref><ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 15 April 2005, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/former-minister-caglars-sentence-upheld.aspx?pageID=438&n=former-minister-caglars-sentence-upheld-2005-04-15 Former minister Çağlar's sentence upheld]</ref> He had initially been acquitted in 2002, but the government appealed.<ref>[[Turkish Daily News]], 5 December 2002, [http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/caglar-acquitted-after-four-year-trial.aspx?pageID=438&n=caglar-acquitted-after-four-year-trial-2002-12-05 Caglar acquitted after four-year trial]</ref>

{{Infobox company | name=Chartered Management Institute | logo = Chartered Management Institute logo.svg | type = | foundation = 1947, Royal Charter 2002 | location = [[Corby]] and [[London]] | key_people = | industry = | products = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | parent = | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.managers.org.uk www.managers.org.uk] | footnotes = }}
The '''Chartered Management Institute''' ('''CMI''') is an [[accredited]] professional institution for [[management]] based in the [[United Kingdom]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://register.ofqual.gov.uk/Organisation/Details/RN5128|title=The Register of Regulated Qualifications - View Organisation : CMI (Chartered Management Institute)|work=ofqual.gov.uk}}</ref>
The major membership classes are ''Member'', ''Fellow'' - for those with significant expertise - and ''Companion'' - the most senior grade.
In addition to supporting its members, the organisation encourages management development, carries out research, produces a wide variety of publications on management interests, and publishes the official members' magazine, ''[[Professional Manager]]''. The Institute also engages with [[government]] and other [[public bodies]] concerning policy on management and business related issues. ''Professional Manager'' magazine is circulated to over 80,000 members of the CMI.
== Chartered Fellow (CMgr FCMI) ==
The Chartered Manager process requires candidates to demonstrate how they have developed as a manager and how they have applied their leadership and change management skills to achieve significant business impact.
There are three routes to becoming Chartered:
'''Exemption Route''' - Available to those who have completed a CMI Level 5 Diploma or above.
'''Qualified Route''' - Available to those who hold a degree level management qualification.
'''Experiential Route''' - Available to those who have the relevant experience, but who do not currently hold a management qualification.
Criteria and requirements for chartered status in the UK have to be approved by the [[Privy Council of the United Kingdom|Privy Council]] and as such the Chartered Manager designation is on par with other chartered qualifications in other fields.
== History == Timeline<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.managers.org.uk/|title=Management - Leadership - CMI - CMI|work=managers.org.uk}}</ref>
*1945 - Sir Stafford Cripps, the President of the Board of Trade appointed a Committee, under the chairmanship of Sir Clive Baillieu (President of the Federation of British Industries - the forerunner of the CBS) to formulate detailed proposals for the establishment of a central institution for all aspects related to management.
One of the reasons behind this move was the realisation that, although there were professional bodies representing functional activities, there was no comparable body for general management thinking and for the development and promotion of better management.
*1947 - Following the recommendations of the [[Baillieu Report]], the British Institute of Management (BIM) was formed. *1951 - The UK's first Diploma in Management Studies was introduced by the BIM and the Ministry of Education. *1987 - The BIM, in conjunction with other bodies, issued two pivotal reports, The making of British managers (John Constable and Roger McCormick), and The making of managers (Charles Handy). These reports led to the formation of the National Forum for Management Education and Development (NFMED) and, subsequently, the Management Charter Initiative (MCI), which spearheaded the issue of the world's first competency-based national management standards. *1992 - BIM merged with the Institution of Industrial Managers (IIM) to form the Institute of Management (IM). The awarding body status of the IIM was transferred to the new Institute. *2000 - The Institute accredited its 250th approved centre to deliver IM management qualifications. *2001 - The [[Institute of Interim Management]] was formed as a Special Interest Group within the Institute of Management. *2002 - The Institute of Management was awarded a [[Royal Charter]] and became the Chartered Management Institute. *2002 - The Institute's management qualifications were recognised as part of the UK's National Qualifications Framework for Higher Education. *2002 - The Institute of Interim Management by mutual agreement with the CMI, gained an independent status. *2003 - The Chartered Manager designation was launched. *2005 - The [[Institute of Management Consultancy]] (IMC) became an 'organisation within the Institute' *2005 – The Institute assumed the Presidency of the European Management Association (EMA) for a three-year term *2005 - The Institute's first National Convention is held at the Queen's Hotel in Leeds *2006 – The Institute of Business Advisers (IBA) became an 'organisation with the Institute' and discussions commenced with a view to achieving a merger between IBA and IMC by mid-2007 *2007 - National Convention held in Birmingham at the Hilton Metropole *2007 - IBA becomes IBC, the Institute of Business Consulting *2008 - Ruth Spellman is appointed Chief Executive *2008 - National Convention held in Birmingham at the Hilton Metropole *2009 - National Convention held in London at the London Hilton Metropole. *2011 - Ruth Spellman suddenly leaves CMI in August with Christopher Kinsella being appointed as interim CE *2011 - A survey of members, conducted by Huw Hilditch-Roberts, concluded that branches should be scrapped in order to improve engagement with the membership. *2012 - Ann Francke is appointed in June as Chief Executive. *2013 - New Regional Chairmen appointed and Regional Boards elected to take over from branches in October. *2014 - Mike Clasper is appointed as President<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.directorstalk.com/interview-mike-clasper-new-president-chartered-management-institute/|title=Interview: Mike Clasper the new President of Chartered Management Institute|author=AIM News|work=directorstalk.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141113074951/http://www.directorstalk.com/interview-mike-clasper-new-president-chartered-management-institute/|archivedate=2014-11-13|df=}}</ref>
== Membership ==
* '''Student ''' - Must be studying a relevant management qualification at any level no. * '''Affiliate ''' - Requires no experience or qualifications. * '''Associate (ACMI)''' - Requires a management qualification at Certificate, Diploma or S/NVQ level OR a minimum of 3 years management experience. This grade carries entitlement to use the designatory letters ACMI. *'''Member (MCMI)''' - Requires a management qualification at degree level/equivalent AND a minimum of 3 years management experience. This grade carries entitlement to use the designatory letters MCMI. *'''Fellow (FCMI)''' - Requires a management qualification at degree level/equivalent AND a minimum of 10 years’ management experience, three of which must be at a strategic level. This grade carries entitlement to use the designatory letters FCMI and is granted by an Assessment Panel *'''Companion (CCMI)''' - The most senior grade of membership, awarded by invitation only.<ref>[http://www.managers.org.uk/management-training-and-qualifications/become-better-manager/cmi-companions/cmi-companions CMI - CMI Companions] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120223182819/http://www.managers.org.uk/management-training-and-qualifications/become-better-manager/cmi-companions/cmi-companions |date=February 23, 2012 }} retrieved 05 Feb 2012</ref>
== Qualifications ==
===General Management and Leadership ===
Each level follows a format whereby a number of credits gained lead to an Award (which develops basic skills and knowledge appropriate to that level), Certificate (covers a broader area and builds on knowledge gained in the award), and Diploma (where a comprehensive range of skills and knowledge are gained.<ref>[http://www.managers.org.uk/training-development-qualifications/personal-development/qualifications/which-qualification-right-for-me%3F Charting all CMI Qualifications] {{dead link|date=April 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> *Level 2 [[Award]], [[wikt:certificate|Certificate]] & [[Diploma]] in [[Team leader|Team Leading]] *Level 3 Award, Certificate & Diploma in [[Line management|First Line Management]] *Level 4 Award, Certificate & Diploma in [[Management]] and [[Leadership]] *Level 5 Award, Certificate & Diploma in Management and Leadership *Level 6 Award, Certificate & Diploma in Management and Leadership *Level 7 Award, Certificate & Diploma in [[Strategic management|Strategic Management]] and Leadership *Level 8 Award, Certificate & Diploma in Strategic Direction and Leadership
===Coaching and Mentoring Awards===
The CMI also accredits Coaching and [[Mentoring]] qualifications to support the development of coaching and mentoring skills and techniques of individuals, teams and achieve objectives.<ref>[http://www.trainingreference.co.uk/news/co091023.htm/ Training Reference (website accessed 02/07/2010] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100301154747/http://www.trainingreference.co.uk/news/co091023.htm/ |date=March 1, 2010 }}</ref>
*Level 3 Award, Certificate & Diploma in Coaching and Mentoring *Level 5 Award, Certificate & Diploma in Coaching and Mentoring *Level 7 Award, Certificate & Diploma in Coaching and Mentoring
=== N/SVQs ===
*Level 2 S/NVQ in Team Leading *Level 3 S/NVQ in Management *Level 4 S/NVQ in Management *Level 5 S/NVQ in Management
Management and Leadership qualifications can be accessed through accredited centres. When choosing the correct management qualification to study it is important to first choose the correct level of qualification, which will largely be driven by experience and previous study. Level 5 qualification are foundation degree level equivalent and level 7 equates to postgraduate masters level. Once the correct level of qualification has been chosen it is then possible to decide on the size of the qualification.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.managers.gb.com/FAQ%27s/Deciding-on-the-right-management-qualification.html/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-10-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100204000558/http://www.managers.gb.com/FAQ%27s/Deciding-on-the-right-management-qualification.html |archivedate=2010-02-04 |df= }}</ref>
